According	According to Barry McCaffrey of the US Office of National Drug Control Policy , Dutch tolerance has allowed the Netherlands to become a criminal epicentre for illicit synthetic drug manufacture , particularly ecstasy , as well as the home for production and worldwide export of strains of cannabis with THC reportedly 10 times higher than normal . Anybody	Anybody who ' s experienced it , actually been addicted to it , knows how profound that addiction is ... . The difficult thing about marijuana addiction is some people , even though they ' re addicted can do fine with it for many many years before they start to have difficultly , but eventually the high starts wearing off , people start smoking a lot more to try to get that high back and that ' s when they descend into difficulties . The Advisory Council	The Advisory Council on the Misuse of Drugs ( ACMD ) recommended a ban on 29 March , which was quickly passed into law , but the decision was criticised for being politically rather than scientifically driven and led to the resignation of the ACMD ' s Eric Carlin , the eighth member of the council to leave in five months in protest at what was seen as political interference .	O

on	The Advisory Council on the Misuse of Drugs ( ACMD ) recommended a ban on 29 March , which was quickly passed into law , but the decision was criticised for being politically rather than scientifically driven and led to the resignation of the ACMD ' s Eric Carlin , the eighth member of the council to leave in five months in protest at what was seen as political interference . The Rand Corp	The Rand Corp . said it believes that marijuana use could double in California if legalization passes due to dramatically reduced prices and increased social acceptance – which , in turn , might increase various health risks , including increased heart rate , anxiety as well as incidents of drug-impaired driving . Chronic marijuana use	Chronic marijuana use is connected with what , in popular culture , has been called slacker behavior – increased risk of dropping out of school , lower achievement , diminished IQ and probably lower life satisfaction – not to mention addiction , physical dependence and withdrawal symptoms .	HEALTH/PSYCHOLOGICAL EFFECTS

withdrawal symptoms	Chronic marijuana use is connected with what , in popular culture , has been called slacker behavior – increased risk of dropping out of school , lower achievement , diminished IQ and probably lower life satisfaction – not to mention addiction , physical dependence and withdrawal symptoms .	ADDICTION

Proposition 64	“ Proposition 64 finally creates a safe , legal and comprehensive system for adult use of marijuana while protecting our children , ” said the ballot argument , whose signers include Donald O. Lyman , former chief of chronic disease and injury control for the state Department of Public Health , and Stephen Downing , former deputy chief for the Los Angeles Police Department .	O
